title: How to Make Gluten Free Artichoke Dip

steps.headline: Empty the artichoke hearts into your food processor.
Close the lid of your blending container and pulse the ingredients on and off until they're finely chopped.
Empty the mixture into a medium mixing bowl.
Add the onion, sour cream, cheese and lemon juice to the bowl.
Sprinkle in a pinch of salt and pepper, to taste.
Mix the ingredients together with a wooden spoon until well blended.
Spoon the mixture into your baking dish and set it aside.
Melt the butter in a small skillet over low heat.
Add the almond slices and toss them in the butter with your wooden spoon until they're well coated.
steps.description: Sauté them for about 5 minutes, or until they start turning golden brown and the butter starts to bubble.

steps.headline: Place the buttered almonds on top of the dip.
Place the container with your dip on a cookie sheet.
steps.description: This is a good rule of thumb to prevent your oven from getting dirty and from things burning on the oven floor, changing the flavor of your dish.

steps.headline: Bake the dish in the center of your oven for 20 minutes or until the edges start to bubble.
Remove it from the oven and allow it to cool slightly for a few minutes.
Serve the dip hot with gluten-free crackers or crudites.

text: Prepare the mixture Empty the artichoke hearts into your food processor.  Add the garlic clove.  Close the lid of your blending container and pulse the ingredients on and off until they're finely chopped.  Empty the mixture into a medium mixing bowl.  Add the onion, sour cream, cheese and lemon juice to the bowl.  Sprinkle in a pinch of salt and pepper, to taste.  Mix the ingredients together with a wooden spoon until well blended.  Plate, Bake and Serve Spoon the mixture into your baking dish and set it aside.  Melt the butter in a small skillet over low heat.  Add the almond slices and toss them in the butter with your wooden spoon until they're well coated. Sauté them for about 5 minutes, or until they start turning golden brown and the butter starts to bubble. Place the buttered almonds on top of the dip.  Place the container with your dip on a cookie sheet. This is a good rule of thumb to prevent your oven from getting dirty and from things burning on the oven floor, changing the flavor of your dish. Bake the dish in the center of your oven for 20 minutes or until the edges start to bubble.  Remove it from the oven and allow it to cool slightly for a few minutes.  Serve the dip hot with gluten-free crackers or crudites.
